task package¶

Submodules¶

task.http_api module¶

This module is used for making HTTP request with the intended network

task.http_api.http_connect(url_inp, url_data, url_method, params, data_size)[source]¶

This function makes a http connection with the intended network

Parameters:

  • url_inp – is a value of type string which specifies the url to have HTTP connection with

  • url_data – can be a string or dictionary specifying additional data for the connection

  • url_method – this specifies the connection method

  • params – this is of type dict and specifies additional paramaters

  • data_size – this is of type int mentioning the size of data to be read

Returns:

it returns a string which is the response for the request made to intended url

task.main module¶

task.range_ip module¶

This module is genereating ip addresses for a given CIDR network

task.range_ip.generate_ip(inp_ip)[source]¶

This function will take input of the CIDR network and return list of range of IP addresses

Parameters:

String (It takes input of CIDR network of the form) –

Returns:

It returns a tuple which consists of the type of network and a list of IP addresses

task.tcp_server_code module¶

This module is the TCP Server and the Client as well

class task.tcp_server_code.ThreadedTCPRequestHandler(request, client_address, server)[source]¶

Bases: BaseRequestHandler

handle()[source]¶
class task.tcp_server_code.ThreadedTCPServer(server_address, RequestHandlerClass, bind_and_activate=True)[source]¶

Bases: ThreadingMixIn, TCPServer

task.tcp_server_code.client(ip, port, message)[source]¶

This function is the client for the TCP Server

Parameters:

  • ip – is a value of type string mentioning the ip network

  • port – is number of type int specifying the port number

  • message – is the value of type string mentioning the message/data to be sent to server

Returns:

There is no implicit return, we are saving every response in the returned_data list

task.tcp_server_code.start_server_TCP(list_cmd)[source]¶

This function starts the TCP Server

Parameters:

  • server (list_cmd is a list of commands which are to executed by the) –

  • string (each element must be of type) –

Returns:

returns a list of saved responses

task.udp_client module¶

This module is the client for the UDP Server

task.udp_client.start_server_UDP(data)[source]¶

This function acts as the client for UDP Server

Parameters:

server (data is value of type string which is to be executed on the) –

Returns:

This function recieves the data and returns the recieved data

task.udp_server_code module¶

This module is the UDP Server

class task.udp_server_code.MyUDPHandler(request, client_address, server)[source]¶

Bases: BaseRequestHandler

This class works similar to the TCP handler class, except that self.request consists of a pair of data and client socket, and since there is no connection the client address must be given explicitly when sending data back via sendto().

handle()[source]¶
task.udp_server_code.server_UDP()[source]¶

This function starts the UDP Server and it should be started from a different terminal for tests to run successfully

task.xmlrpc_client_code module¶

This module is the xmlrpc client

task.xmlrpc_client_code.xmlrpc_client(data)[source]¶

This function acts as the client for xmlrpc server

Parameters:

calculated (data is a list of elements each of type int who's fibonacci number are to be) –

Returns:

function returns a list of string with Fibonacci Number for each element in the Args

task.xmlrpc_server_code module¶

This module is the xmlrpc server

task.xmlrpc_server_code.fib(n)[source]¶

This is a fibonacci series function

Parameters:

int (n is a value of type) –

Returns:

the function returns the (n)th number of the Fibonacci Series

task.xmlrpc_server_code.xmlrpc_server()[source]¶

This function act as the server for xmlrpc_server to execute Fibonacci Program from a remote client server
